title: So I tried out Aatrox and here are my thoughts
body:
https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/content/wallpaper/base-splash.jpg

##NOTE: I'm not making this to be a post of complaint, i'm just simply stating my opinion on Aatrox after playing him several times.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##PASSIVE: DEATHBRINGER STANCE

* I don't know why this passive get's consumed when basic attacking minions, because the Cooldown of that is around 20+ secs at level 1. 

* I find that this passive's damage is the only part of his kit that seems notice-able.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##Q: THE DARKIN BLADE

* This ability feels quite clunky to use, because you always need to use your E to land it properly due to how easy it is to dodge it.

* It's quite difficult to use this ability because of how each cast has a different range. I assume that this was the ability that introduces the higher skill requirement to his new kit.

* Sometimes this ability Critically Strikes and sometimes it doesn't, might be a bug perhaps, or maybe not, nothing is certain still.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##W: INFERNAL CHAINS

* This ability doesn't really feel all that useful aside from the bonus CC that he already has. 

* The damage is really minor.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##E: UMBRAL DASH

* The passive sustain is somewhat good at later stages of the game, but it's completely incomparable to what current Aatrox's sustain is like (current Aatrox has better sustain).

* The active dash doesn't make any sense by looking how short the dash is, seems like a massive downgrade of what Dark Flight was. It just feels like it's used to serve to be used mainly as a synergy tool with his Q.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##R: WORLD ENDER

* Nice Movement Speed boost.

* The bonus damage is really un-noticeble (just gain a small amount of AD, very tiny).

* Him having a revive every time he has R up is nice but outside of this and the Movement Speed boost it feels pointless.

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-aatrox/en_US/3a2cd8032f93d3aadf42219a6c19ccfcc5e7792f/assets/img/global/accents/accent-pullquote.png

##Conclusion

_Positives_

* Has a lot of CC to provide for his team.
* Has potentially more reliable sustain, since now he isn't required to basic attack 3 times to heal anymore.
* Has some-what more AoE damage.
* Has some good catching potential with his W.
* He might be a good jungler, with his AoE damage, Knock Ups and Sustain.
* When Aatrox revives he can actually move now.

_Negatives_

* Quite weak on really close combat.
* No longer has the ability to duel someone.
* Q has potential of being good, but currently it offers opponents a window to engage while you cast the ability. 
* W having a similar issue as his E, having no offensive power aside from the CC or having the ability to catch someone.
* E Active ability potentially too weak of an ability on it's own.
* Using R feels underwhelming, in terms of offensive power.

And it's not like we haven't seen these "complaints" before.
Something feels bad on PBE, people complain before the right time, Riot buffs it, gets to Live, becomes the top pick for their role and lane. Then Riot either has to hotfix it if it's an immediate issue or they do it after a patch or two. Secondly, if the numbers are wrong for the "right spot" and "in the face" AoE, that can be buffed appropriately when tested on Live.

His ult is mainly about the revive more than anything else. The revive is a REALLY strong ability and take a HUGE chunk out of his power budget, so it would make since that the AD boost feels a bit weak...Because its mainly about the revive

Yeah. The fact that it gives permanent 240 move speed out of combat means you can Quinn your way into fights, or chase *really* well. It has 12 second duration too.

The biggest reason revives are either worthless or meh is because you're stationary and out of the action. But this revive. is fast, *and you can move*. You no longer have the stupid situation where when you Rez all your targets are 600 units away from you and you need to reclose the distance.

Not just the fact that your targets are 600 units away, but it was basically a zhonya that activated when you died; people like Caitlyn would just drop a trap on where you were going to revive and you could do nothing as you got snared by it and took an empowered attack. How champions like mages could toss out their CC spell exactly when you would get up and you couldn't dodge it.

In other words, it went from "only really useful when both of us die in laning and I have this" to something that can be much more helpful.

Yeah. I feel like people are really, really underselling the strength of the ult, simply because we've *never had* anything like it before. The closest comparisons are "Sion passive, but he's *invulnerable* for a short while", and "Kled dismount, but it takes a lot longer and is mobile". It's honestly one of the strongest ults I've seen in this game, excluding global teleportation ults and giant AoE ults.
